docs.snippet: The Brazilian federation presented evidence to the FIFA disciplinary committee and demanded action against Colombia’s Juan Camilo Zúñiga....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Brazilian federation presented evidence to the FIFA disciplinary committee and demanded action against Colombia’s Juan Camilo Zúñiga.
docs.abstract: World Cup Roundup; FIFA is being pressured by Brazil's soccer federation to punish, Juan Camilo Zuniga, Colombian player whose tackle caused injury that has sidelined Neymar, Brazil's top player, for rest of World Cup; other news noted.

headline.main: Brazil Lobbies for Punishment of the Colombian Player Who Injured Neymar
headline.print_headline: Brazil Lobbies for Punishment of the Colombian Player Who Injured Neymar

byline.original: By ANDREW DAS and DAVID WALDSTEIN

docs.snippet: A puzzle by Marco Moriconi to celebrate the FIFA World Cup 2014....

docs.snippet: The NCAA is suggesting that football teams hold no more than two contact practices per week during the season in guidelines that grew out of a safety and concussion summit early this year....
docs.lead_paragraph: The NCAA is suggesting that football teams hold no more than two contact practices per week during the season in guidelines that grew out of a safety and concussion summit early this year.

headline.main: NCAA Suggests Contact Limits for Football Practice

docs.snippet: Brasilia has been one of the focal points of the World Cup but there will not be much football for the country's capital to look forward when the tournament leaves town following the third place match on Saturday....

docs.snippet: A Massachusetts judge agreed on Monday to transfer former National Football League star Aaron Hernandez to a state jail near Boston and closer to his lawyers as he prepares for two trials where he will face charges of murdering three men....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Massachusetts judge agreed on Monday to transfer former National Football League star Aaron Hernandez to a state jail near Boston and closer to his lawyers as he prepares for two trials where he will face charges of murdering three men.

headline.main: Massachusetts Judge OKs Moving Ex-NFLer Hernandez to Boston Jail
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts Judge OKs Moving Ex-NFLer Hernandez to Boston Jail

docs.snippet: Neymar and the Brazilian football confederation denied media reports that the striker could undergo special treatment on his fractured vertebra to try to play in the World Cup final if the tournament hosts make it that far....
